definition: to halt/to stop/to go no farther
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: You learn a lot in the beginning and then stagnate.
sentences.chinese: 一開始，你會學到很多，但是之後你就止步不前了。

sentences.english: Jeff's hardheaded analysis does not stop at why and how to do all this.
sentences.chinese: 薩克斯無懈可擊的分析，並不止步於推導和建議。

sentences.english: And, don't stop with green vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 而且，不要止步於綠色的蔬菜。

sentences.english: FC Bayern DFB Cup campaign ended in the quarterfinals.
sentences.chinese: 德國杯止步於四分之一決賽。

sentences.english: But, like most of his colleagues, Keller doesn’t stop there.
sentences.chinese: 但是，和他大多數的同事一樣，凱勒並沒有就此止步。

sentences.english: The noise of dogs made me a stranger here.
sentences.chinese: 狗吠聲讓我變成異鄉人，讓我止步難前。

sentences.english: Architects' vertical leapfrogging, however, isn't likely to stop at the Burj Khalifa.
sentences.chinese: 然而建築師們的垂直躍升遊戲並不太可能就此止步。

sentences.english: JAQUET solutions don't stop with standard product lines.
sentences.chinese: JAQUET的解決方案不會止步於標準的生產線。

sentences.english: The lack of balanced capactiy is the main reason why most of people cease to advance in their workplace.
sentences.chinese: 缺少平衡力是大部分人在職場上止步不前的重要原因。
但是伯努利並沒有止步於此。

sentences.english: Neither the United States nor China is content to rest on our achievements.
sentences.chinese: 美國和中國都不想滿足於已取得的成就，止步不前。

sentences.english: It’s not like we just stumbled upon this subject.
sentences.chinese: 它不象我們在這個問題的上的止步不前。

sentences.english: They may have dreams, but the “imprinting” keeps pulling them back.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能有夢想，但“烙印”讓他們止步不前。

sentences.english: The familial allusion was left off the album.
sentences.chinese: 這張專輯上對家庭的影射就此止步。

sentences.english: They must take a break from their voracious consumption.
sentences.chinese: 他們那種貪婪的消費必須止步了。

definition: to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)

to send off (player for a foul)/to knock out (i.e. to beat in a knock-out tournament)/to eliminate/to call out/to kill off/to pull out of (a competition)/to retire (a runner in baseball)/out (i.e. man out in baseball)
with a grunting sound it stops (idiom); to come to an end spontaneously (esp. of sound)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to dither/to hesitate/to pace back and forth/by ext. to hover around/to linger
